creator: eyaly@e4x.com
text:
when value of an entry in propertyfile contain '=' or ':' the result property file will have a 
slash before those characters.
According to java doc (in page http://java.sun.com/j2se/1.3/docs/api/java/util/Properties.html 
look for store method) only keys are rewriten ("The key and value characters #, !, =, and : are 
written with a preceding slash to ensure that they are properly loaded") but not values.

It seems like values are allowed to have those characters with out preceding slash.
Why do you add those slashes ?

creator: knut@paranor.ch
text:
If you reread the quote ("The key and value characters #, !, =, and : are 
written with a preceding slash to ensure that they are properly loaded") 
carefully you will notice that it's stated that the key *and* value characters 
#, !, =, and : are escaped with a preceding backslash.

So <propertyfile> works exactly as java.util.Properties.store().
